name: 4'-(methylthio)acetophenone
Reason: 4'-(methylthio)acetophenone has a melting point influenced by its functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The methylthio group introduces a sulfur atom, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C. The methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, reducing the crystal lattice stability, which might decrease the melting point by approximately -10°C. The acetophenone group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can form hydrogen bonds and rigidify the structure, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C.
